radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Signs of vertebral hemangiomas (honeycomb aspect of the vertebral body) had already been present at the levels of T6–7 and L-5.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the spine
radiographic_examinations.findings: Vertebral hemangiomas at multiple levels with stenosis and compression maximal at level T5–6.
Vascularized lesions of the vertebral body at the C-6 and T-2 levels, T5–8 levels, and L-5 level.
Good decompression of the spinal cord at the T5–7 level.
Lesions stable, spinal cord compression at C-6 and L-5 levels almost completely eliminated.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Slight regression of the cervical and lumbar hemangiomas, stability of the hemangioma at T-6.
